snippet: The remnants of a magnificent Buddhist city that reached its height in the 11th and 12th centuries are helping Myanmar open up to the outside world.
abstract: Scholarly interest in Myanmar is surging as the country opens itself to the outside world; country is home to several archaeologically significant sites, including Bagan, a sprawling complex of shrines and temples constructed in the 11th and 12th centuries.
lead_paragraph: The remnants of a magnificent Buddhist city that reached its height in the 11th and 12th centuries are helping Myanmar open up to the outside world.

headline.main: Gateway to Myanmar’s Past, and Its Future
headline.print_headline: Gateway to Myanmar’s Past, and Its Future
